title: The Writer's Almanac - Wednesday, November 3, 2021
description: The last public execution at London's Tyburn Gallows took place on this date in 1783. And 100 years later, 1883, the outlaw who called himself "Black Bart the poet" robbed his last stagecoach.
itunes:author: Prairie Home Productions
itunes:subtitle: The last public execution at London's Tyburn Gallows took place on this date in 1783. And 100 years later, 1883, the outlaw who called himself "Black Bart the poet" robbed his last stagecoach.
